text: I don't have a well-formed opinion on this topic, but I know the Databox blog writes about topics like this quite a bit. The CEO of Databox started HubSpot's Partner program and has a LOT of experience working with marketing agencies and the product is built to make it easier for marketing agencies to report on results to clients.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz

text:
Very common! I ran the communications team at HubSpot and while we had some team members who did more content creation than others, if you're working in PR..you're doing content.

I hired from both traditional PR as well as traditional content backgrounds. The PR folks are stronger on media strategy, pitching, integrating their work into a larger campaign launch. Content people tend to be better writers and do a better job working on executive bylines, creating speaking decks, stuff like that.

I would just be clear on what you need most. It's not difficult to find people from both backgrounds who can do both PR & CM, but if you need a great content creator to do some pitching -- hire a great CM. If you need who is strong on media relations/PR strategy to write some content -- hire a PR person.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz

text:
If you want to do a lot of media work, it is worth hiring a real media relations pro, because someone who is good at that work is more like a sales person than a content person. It's really special to see them in action :slightly_smiling_face:

But if you're mostly pitching other blogs, events, and guest blogs -- that's well in the wheelhouse of a well-rounded content marketer...and by well-rounded I mean someone who does general CM and isn't specifically focused on SEO.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz

text: I'm curious about the content syndication landscape and how to successfully navigate it. I'm also interested in techniques for producing multimedia content. Also, it would be cool to hear techniques about managing a geodispersed content team. Thanks for asking, <@UJJPC6Z0W>.

To the content marketers who use WordPress -- I'm working on building a side project/passion project, which is a comic-blog: <http://ritikamonster.wp-engine.com>.
